item.description:
Raphael Sirtoli on Twitter

“Taking 2.4 mg of semaglutide (Ozempic) for 68 weeks resulted in a reduction of food intake and a loss of nearly 17% of body weight https://t.co/dti2RN3f4m But the weight you lose from this drugs is different than the typical weight that’s lost from dieting or bariatric surgery.…”

URL: https://twitter.com/raphaels7/status/1662021374276255746

source: Monday assorted links

item.description:
Christopher James on Twitter

“The title: @tylercowen pulling the levers of the economy. The prompt: Tyler Cowen deciding whether to give all his Emergent Venture money to Jordan Chase-Young to produce MidJourney techno-optimist propaganda after realising this is the highest expected-value lever-arm on Earth.”

URL: https://twitter.com/roundlay/status/1661180777160114177

source: Sunday assorted links

item.title: Schmidhuber on the future of AI
item.description:
hardmaru on Twitter

“Interview with Jürgen Schmidhuber, ‘Father Of Modern AI’, who says his life’s work won’t lead to dystopia. He goes quite in depth into his views about the future of AI and AGI. A refreshing view of things, compared to other ‘influential leaders’ in AI. https://t.co/YWUF3V6d70”

URL: https://twitter.com/hardmaru/status/1661182353518080000?s=61&t=WYHH-GF0B1jdQqRCq2zVPA

source: Sunday assorted links

item.description:
This is the nineteenth piece in Lorenzo Warby’s series of essays on the strange and disorienting times in which we live. The publication schedule is available here. Meanwhile, Arnold Kling has a thoughtful response to Essay 17—Lorenzo’s penultimate piece on feminisation, feminists, and the Emancipation Sequence…

URL: https://helendale.substack.com/p/diversity-inclusion-equity-as-bureaucratic?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Links to Consider, 5/29
